All Implemented Interfaces:
InputProvider, Terminal
Direct Known Subclasses:
ANSITerminal
public abstract class StreamBasedTerminal
extends InputEnabledAbstractTerminal

An abstract terminal implementing functionality for terminals using OutputStream/InputStream

Author:
Martin

 void flush()
          Calls flush() on the underlying OutputStream object, or whatever other implementation this terminal is built around.
 void putCharacter(char c)
          Outputs a single character to the terminal output stream, translating any UTF-8 graphical symbol if necessary
protected  byte[] translateCharacter(char input)
           
protected  void writeToTerminal(byte... bytes)
          Allow subclasses (that are supposed to know what they're doing) to write directly to the terminal
Warning! Be sure to call this method INSIDE of a synchronize(writeMutex) block!!!
The reason is that many control sequences are a group of bytes and we want to synchronize the whole thing rather than each character one by one.

Method Detail

putCharacter

public void putCharacter(char c)
Outputs a single character to the terminal output stream, translating any UTF-8 graphical symbol if necessary

Parameters:
c - Character to write to the output stream
Throws:
LanternaException

writeToTerminal

protected void writeToTerminal(byte... bytes)
Allow subclasses (that are supposed to know what they're doing) to write directly to the terminal
Warning! Be sure to call this method INSIDE of a synchronize(writeMutex) block!!!
The reason is that many control sequences are a group of bytes and we want to synchronize the whole thing rather than each character one by one.

flush

public void flush()
Description copied from interface: Terminal
Calls flush() on the underlying OutputStream object, or whatever other implementation this terminal is built around.
